                Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) questions Cecile Richards, President of Planned Parenthood, at a hearing on September 29, 2015.  | JOHN SHINKLE/POLITICO

                        The Ohio Republican will remain the group's leader.

            By 
Lauren French

11/16/15 08:49 PM EST
The House Freedom Caucus has tapped Ohio Republican Rep. Jim Jordan to serve a second term as the chair of the conservative group. 
During a private meeting Monday, the nearly year-old group unanimously elected Jordan as its leader. 
Story Continued Below
It was not a surprising outcome. Jordan is widely respected by his peers in the conservative caucus and faced no challengers.
The group has had a successful year under Jordan's leadership. He's maneuvered the group through its first year with a handful of political and legislative wins — notably being one of the catalysts that forced former Speaker John Boehner from that post. 
The group was created in January to counterbalance what conservatives viewed as a growing trend of compromise of Republican policies by the GOP leadership team. The 40 lawmakers forced a temporary shutdown of the Export-Import Bank and nearly caused a partial government shutdown in protest of President Barack Obama's executive actions on immigration.
Jordan will serve as chairman for the next year. The group hopes to outline in that time their policy agenda in a document conservative lawmakers have taken to calling the second "Contract with America" — an ode to the document outline by Newt Gingrich in the 1990s that helped usher in a commanding Republican majority in the House.
The Freedom Caucus also elected two new board members on Monday. Reps. Jeff Duncan (R-S.C.) and Steve Pearce (R-N.M.) will join the seven-member board. 
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: The Ohio Republican will remain the group's leader.
title: House Freedom Caucus re-elects Jordan
